Traverse.definition: a denial of a matter of fact alleged in the opposing party's pleadings ;also

1.1: a denial of a matter of fact alleged in the opposing party's pleadings

2.1: a pleading in which such a denial is made
2.traverser: literally, to lay across, bar, impede, from Old French, from Late Lat

3.1: to deny (as an allegation of fact or an indictment) in a legal proceeding
